file.string: Have all 8 Provinces at the end of a 2 player game
Have 10 or more Provinces at the end of a 3 or 4 player game
Win a game with 100 or more VP
Win a game with 100 or more VP without any cards from Prosperity
Win a game with 500 or more VP
Win a game by exactly 1 VP
Win a game buying no more than one unique Kingdom Card
Win a game by more than 50 VP
Win a game with at least one opponent having 0 or less VP
Trash more than 5 cards in a single turn
Gain more than 30 VP in a single turn
Overpay for a card by 10 or more
Play two Tacticians in same turn, discarding at least one card each time
Win a game with exactly 13 Curses in your deck
Win a game with no cards left in the Supply in any pile
When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, you are unaffected by that Attack.
Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 2 Treasure cards. Put those Treasure cards into your hand and discard the other revealed cards.
Gain a Silver onto your deck. Each other player reveals a Victory card from their hand and puts it onto their deck (or reveals a hand with no Victory cards).
Discard any number of cards, then draw that many.
You may immediately put your deck into your discard pile.
Trash up to 4 cards from your hand.
Each other player draws a card.
Trash this card. Gain a card costing up to 5 Coins.
Draw until you have 7 cards in hand, skipping any Action cards you choose to; set those aside, discarding them afterwards.
Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand.
You may trash a Treasure from your hand. Gain a Treasure to your hand costing up to (3) Coins more than it.
You may trash a Copper from your hand for +(3) Coins.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to (2) Coins more than it.
Each player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice.

Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck. If they revelaed any Treasure cards, they trash one of them that you choose. You may gain any or all of these trashed cards. They discard the other revealed cards.
You may play an Action card from your hand twice.
Each other player gains a Curse.
Gain a card costing up to (4) Coins.
Worth 1 Victory Point for every 10 cards in your deck (rounded down).
Gain a card to your hand costing up to (5) Coins. Put a card from your hand onto your deck.
Gain a Gold. Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of their deck, trashes a revealed treasure other than Copper, and discards the rest.
Look through your discard pile. You may put a card from it onto your deck.
The first time you play a Silver this turn, +(1) Coin.
Discard a card per empty supply pile.
Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Trash and/or discard any number of them. Put the rest back in any order.
Discard the top card of your deck. If it is an Action card, you may play it.
Each other player either discards 2 cards or gains a Curse to their hand, their choice. (They may pick an option they can\'t do.)

Discard any number of cards. +1 Coin per card discarded. When another player plays an Attack card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, +2 Cards, then put 2 cards from your hand on top of your deck.
Copper produces an extra 1 coin this turn.
Put a card from your hand on top of your deck.
You may discard an Estate for +(4) Coins. If you don\'t, gain an Estate.
This turn, cards (everywhere) cost (1) Coin less, but not less than (0) Coins.
If you\'ve played 3 or more Actions this turn (counting this): +1 Card, +1 Action.
Gain a card costing up to 4 Coins. If the gained card is an Action card, +1 Action. Treasure card, +1 Coin. Victory card, +1 Card.
Each player with any cards in hand passes one to the next such player to their left, at once. Then you may trash a card from your hand.
You may trash this for +(2) Coins.
Choose one: +(2) Coins; or discard your hand, +4 Cards, and each other player with at least 5 cards in hand discards their hand and draws 4 cards.
Choose two: +1 Card; +1 Action; +1 Buy; +(1) Coin. The choices must be different.

Each other player reveals cards from the top of his deck until revealing one costing 3 Coins or more. He trashes that card and may gain a card costing at most 2 Coins less than it. He discards the other revealed cards.
Reveal your hand. If you have no Action cards in hand, +2 Cards.
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Victory cards into your hand. Put the other cards on top of your deck in any order.
Choose one: +2 Cards; or +2 Coins; or trash 2 cards from your hand.
Each other player trashes the top card of their deck and gains a card with the same cost that you choose.
Trash 2 cards from your hand. If you do, gain a Silver card; put it into your hand.
Name a card, then reveal the top card of your deck. If you named it, put it into your hand.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing exactly 1 Coin more than it.

The player to your left reveals then discards the top 2 cards of his deck. For each differently named card revealed, if it is an Action Card, +2 Actions. Treasure Card, +2 Coins. Victory Card, +2 Cards.
Worth 1 Victory Point per Duchy you have.
"Reveal a card from your hand. For each type it has (Action, Attack, etc.), choose one: +1 Action; or +1 Buy; or +(3) Coins; or gain a Gold. The choices must be different.
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the Victory cards and Curse cards into your hand. Put the rest back in any order.

Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to (2) Coins more than the trashed card. If the gained card is an Action or Treasure, put it onto your deck. If it\'s a Victory card, each other player gains a Curse.
If you have 5 or fewer cards in hand (after drawing), +2 Actions. When another player plays an Attack card, you may first reveal this from a hand of 5 or more cards, to draw 2 cards then discard 3.
You may discard 2 cards, for +(2) Coins.
Take a card from your hand and put it anywhere in your deck.
Choose one: Trash an Action card from the Supply, or gain an Action card from the trash.
Set aside a card from your hand face down. At the start of your next turn, put it into your hand.
Each other player discards the top card of his deck, then gains a Curse card, putting it on top of his deck.
Discard your hand. If you discarded any cards this way, then at the start of your next turn, +5 Cards, +1 Buy, and +1 Action.
While this is in play, when another player plays an Attack card, it doesn\'t affect you.
You only draw 3 cards (instead of 5) in this turn\'s Clean-up phase. Take an extra turn after this one. This can\'t cause you to take more than two consecutive turns.
Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand puts cards from his hand on top of his deck until he has 3 cards in his hand.
Trash a card from your hand. + Coins equal to its cost.

Choose one: Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes a revealed Treasure that you choose, discards the rest, and if anyone trashed a Treasure you take a Coin token; or, +1 Coin per Coin token you\'ve taken with Pirate Ships this game.
Choose one: Set aside the top card of your deck face down on your Native Village mat; or put all the cards from your mat into your hand.
Set aside this and another card from your hand. Return them to your deck at the end of the game.
Each other player discards a Copper card (or reveals a hand with no Copper).
Gain a copy of a card costing up to 6 Coins that the player to your right gained on his last turn.
You may reveal a Province card from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold card, putting it into your hand. Otherwise, gain a Silver card, putting it into your hand.
Look at the bottom card of your deck. You may put it on top.
Trash this and another copy of Treasure Map from your hand. If you do trash two Treasure Maps, gain 4 Gold cards putting them on top of your deck.
Look at the top 5 cards of your deck. Either discard all of them, or put them back on top of your deck in any order.
When you discard this from play, if you didn\'t buy a Victory card this turn, you may put this on top of your deck.
Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash one of them. Discard one of them. Put the other one on top of your deck.
Reveal a card from your hand. Return up to 2 copies of it from your hand to the Supply. Then each other player gains a copy of it.
Trash this card. Put an Embargo token on top of a Supply pile. When a player buys a card, he gains a Curse card per Embargo token on that pile.
When you discard this from play, you may put this on top of your deck if you have a Potion in play.
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck. Put the revealed Coppers and Potions into your hand. Put the other cards back on top of your deck in any order.
Trash a card from your hand. +1 Card per Coin it costs. +2 Cards if it has a Potion in its cost.
Each other player gains a Curse.
Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal 2 Action cards other than Golem cards. Discard the other cards, then play the Action cards in either order.
When you discard this from play, you may put one of your Treasures from play on top of your deck.
When you play this, count your deck and discard pile. Worth (1) coin per 5 cards total between them (rounded down).

The player to your left takes an extra turn after this one, in which you can see all cards he can and make all decisions for him. Any cards he would gain on that turn, you gain instead; any cards of his that are trashed are set aside and returned to his discard pile at end of turn.

Each player (including you) reveals the top card of his deck and either discards it or puts it back, your choice. Then reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal one that is not an Action. Put all of your revealed cards into your hand.
Trash a card from your hand. If it is an . . . Action card, gain a Duchy; Treasure card, gain a Transmute; Victory card gain a Gold.
You may gain an Action card costing up to 5 Coins.
Worth 1 Victory Point for every 3 Action cards in your deck (rounded down).
When you play this, it\'s worth 1 coin per Treasure card you have in play (counting this).
Trash a card from your hand. Gain Victory tokens equal to half its cost in coins, rounded down. Each other player may trash a card from his hand.
If there are one or more empty Supply piles, +1 Card. If there are two or more, +1 Coin and +1 Buy.
When you play this, the player to your left names a card. You can\'t buy that card this turn.
Look through your discard pile, reveal any number of Copper cards from it, and put them into your hand.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to 3 Coins more than the trashed card.
Trash any number of cards from your hand. Gain a card with cost exactly equal to the total cost in coins of the trashed cards.
Eash other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. While this is in play, when you buy a card, +1 Victory token.
You can\'t buy this if you have any Copper in play.
While this is in play, when you buy a Victory card, gain a Gold.
You may choose an Action card in your hand. Play it three times.
When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard it or trash it. Discard the other cards.
You may reveal a Treasure card from your hand. Gain a copy of it. When you buy this, trash all Treasures you have in play.
Each other player may discard a Curse. If he doesn\'t, he gains a Curse and a Copper.
During your Buy phase, this costs 2 coins less per Action card you have in play, but not less than 0 coins.
While this is in play, Action cards cost 2 coins less, but not less than 0 coins.
Each other player reveals the top 3 cards of his deck, discards the revealed Actions and Treasures, and puts the rest back on top in any order he chooses.
While this is in play, when you gain a card, you may put that card on top of your deck.
While this is in play, when you buy a card costing 4 coins or less that is not a Victory card, gain a copy of it.

+1 Coin per token on the Trade Route mat. Trash a card from your hand. Setup: Put a token on each Victory card Supply pile. When a card is gained from that pile, move the token to the Trade Route mat.
Discard any number of cards. +1 coin per card discarded. Each other player may discard 2 cards. If he does, he draws a card.
When you play this, reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a Treasure. Discard the other cards. Play that Treasure.
Draw until you have 6 cards in hand. When you gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, either trash that card, or put it on top of your deck.
Worth 2 points for every 5 differently named cards in your deck (round down).
Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal an Action or Treasure card. Put that card into your hand and discard the other cards.
Each other player reveals cards from the top of his deck until he reveals a Victory or Curse card. He puts it on top and discards the other revealed cards.
You may discard a card; if you do +1 Action. You may discard a card; if you do +1 Buy.
Reveal the top 4 cards of your deck, then discard them. +1 coin per differently named card revealed.
When you play this, gain a card costing up to 1 Coin per differently named card you have in play, counting this. If it\'s a Victory card, trash this.
Discard 2 cards. When another player plays an Attack card, you may set this aside from your hand. If you do, then at the start of your next turn, +1 Card and return this to your hand.
Reveal your hand. Reveal cards from your deck until you reveal a card that isn\'t a duplicate of one in your hand. Put it into your hand and discard the rest.
Each other player discards the top card of his deck. If it\'s a Victory card, he gains a Curse. Otherwise either he gains a copy of the discarded card or you do, your choice.
Reveal your hand. If there are no duplicate cards in it, +3 Cards. Otherwise, +1 Card.
Do this twice. Trash a card from your hand, then gain a card costing exactly 1 coin more than the trashed card.
Each player may reveal a Province from his hand. If you do, discard it and gain a Prize (from the Prize pile) or a Duchy, putting it on top of your deck. If no one else does, +1 Card, +1 coin.

Discard 2 cards. Each other player may reveal a Bane card from his hand. If he doesn\'t, he gains a Curse. Setup: Add an extra Kingdom card pile costing 2 or 3 coins to the Supply. Cards from that pile are Bane cards.
When you gain this, gain a card costing less than this.
When you gain this, gain two Coppers.
Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. Discard any number of them. Put the rest back on top in any order.
Reveal your hand. +1 Card per Victory card revealed. If this is the first time you played a Crossroads this turn, +3 Actions.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing exactly 1 coin more than it and a card costing exactly 1 less than it, in either order, putting them on top of your deck.
Each player (including you) looks at the top card of his deck, and discards it or puts it back - In games using this, when you gain a Duchy, you may gain a Duchess.
Discard 3 cards - When you gain this, each other player gains a Silver.
When you buy this, trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing exactly 2 coins more than the trashed card.

If this is the first time you played a Fool\'s Gold this turn, this is worth 1 coin, otherwise it\'s worth 4 coins - When another player gains a Province, you may trash this from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold, putting it on your deck.
While this is in play, when you buy a card, gain a card costing less than it that is not a Victory card.
While this is in play, cards cost 1 coin less, but not less than 0 coin.
When you play this, you may gain a Copper, putting it into your hand - When you gain this, each other player gains a Curse.
Discard 2 cards - When you gain this, look through your discard pile (including this), reveal any number of Action cards from it, and shuffle them into your deck.
Gain a Silver. Look at the top card of your deck; discard it or put it back. Draw until you have 5 cards in hand. You may trash a card from your hand that is not a Treasure.
Put a card from your hand on top of your deck - When you gain this, put all Treasures you have in play on top of your deck in any order.
Each other player draws a card, then discards down to 3 cards in hand.

When you buy this or play it, each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes a revealed Silver or Gold you choose, and discards the rest. If he didn\'t reveal a Treasure, he gains a Copper. You gain the trashed cards.
When you gain this, put it on top of your deck.
Each player (including you) reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, and you choose one: either he discards them, or he puts them back on top in an order he chooses.\n+2 Cards
At the start of Clean-up this turn, you may choose an Action card you have in play. If you discard it from play this turn, put it on your deck.
Worth 1 VP for every 4 Victory cards in your deck (round down).
You may trash a Treasure from your hand. If you do, choose one: +2 Cards and +1 Action; or +2 Coin and +1 Buy.
You may discard a Treasure. If you do, +3 Cards and +1 Action.
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a number of Silvers equal to its cost in coins - When you would gain a card, you may reveal this from your hand. If you do, instead, gain a silver.
When you discard this other than during a Clean-up phase, you may reveal it. If you do, gain a Gold.
While this is in play, cards cost 2 coins less, but not less than 0. (This is not in the Supply.)
Gain a Gold, putting it on top of your deck. (This is not in the Supply.)
When you play this, +1 coin per unused Action you have (Action, not Action card). (This is not in the Supply.)
Gain an Estate. Each other player gains a Curse and discards down to 3 cards in hand. (This is not in the Supply.)
Choose two: +2 Cards; +2 Actions; +2 coins; gain 4 silvers and put your deck into your discard pile. (The choices must be different.) (This is not in the Supply.)
Trash a card from your hand. Gain a card costing up to 5 Coins.
Gain a card costing up to 4 Coins. Put it on top of your deck.
Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile.
Play this as if it were an Action card in the supply costing less than it that you choose. This is that card until it leaves play.
You may trash an Action card from your hand. If you don\'t, trash this. When you gain this, gain 2 Ruins.
Worth 1 VP for every 3 Silvers in your deck (round down). When you trash this, gain 3 Silvers.
When you trash this, put it into your hand.
Reveal your hand. -1 coin per treasure card in your hand, to a minimum of 0 coins.
Gain a Rats. Trash a card from your hand other than a Rats (or reveal a hand of all Rats). When you trash this, +1 Card.
Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal one costing 3 coins or more. Put that card into your hand and discard the rest.
Choose one: +2 Actions; or +2 Buys; or gain a Silver. - When you trash this, gain an Attack card.
Gain 3 Coppers, putting them into your hand. When another player plays an Attack card, you may discard this. If you do, gain two Silvers, putting one on top of your deck.
Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Choose one: Put them into your hand; or discard them and +3 Cards. When you trash this, gain a cheaper card.
Choose one: Discard 2 cards; or put a card from your hand on top of your deck; or gain a Copper. Choose one: +3 coins; or trash your hand; or gain a Duchy.
Trash a card from your hand. +1 coin per differently named Treasure in the trash.
Choose one: Gain a card from the trash costing from 3 to 6 coins, putting it on top of your deck; or trash an Action card from your hand and gain a card costing up to 3 more than it.
When you trash this, gain a Duchy or 3 Estates.
Reveal the top card of your deck; you may discard it. Either way, if it is an Action card, +1 Action; Treasure card, + 1 coin; Victory card, +1 Card.
Trash a card from your hand.
When one of your cards is trashed, you may discard this from your hand. If you do, gain a Gold.
Name a card. Reveal the top card of your deck. If its the named card, put it into your hand.
You may put your deck into your discard pile. Look through your discard pile and put one card from it on top of your deck.
Discard any number of cards. +1 Card per card discarded. Discard any number of cards. +1 coin per card discarded the second time.
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Put the Actions back on top in any order and discard the rest.
You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Trash it. Gain an Action card costing exactly 1 more than it.

Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Victory card that is not the named card. Discard the other cards. Trash the Victory card and gain a Victory card costing up to 3 more than it.

If there are any cards in the trash costing from 3 to 6 coins, gain one of them. Otherwise, each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest.
When you play this, you may play a Treasure from your hand twice. If you do, trash that Treasure.
Trash this. Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand reveals his hand and discards a card that you choose. Gain 2 Spoils from the Spoils pile.
When you play this, return it to the Spoils pile. (This is not in the Supply.)
Look at the top 2 cards of your deck. Discard them or put them back in any order.
When you buy a Victory card, you may trash this from your hand
Each other player gains a Ruins. You may play a Cultist from your hand. When you trash this, +3 Cards.
Each other player discards down to 4 cards in hand. When you play another attack card with this in play, you may trash this. If you do, gain a Mercenary from the Mercenary pile.
You may trash 2 cards from your hand. If you do, +2 cards, +2 coins, and each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. (This is not in the Supply.)
Gain a Spoils from the Spoils pile. Each other player gains a Ruins.

Look through your discard pile. You may trash a card from your discard pile or hand that is not a Treasure. Gain a card costing up to 3 Coins. When you discard this from play, if you did not buy any cards this turn, trash this and gain a Madman from the Madman pile.
Return this to the Madman pile. If you do, +1 Card per card in your hand. (This is not in the Supply.)
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it\'s a Curse, Ruins, Shelter, or Victory card, put it into your hand.

You may trash up to 2 cards from your hand. Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.

You may gain a card costing up to 3 Coins. Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.
Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.

Each other player discards down to 3 cards in hand. Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card.

Each other player reveals the top 2 cards of his deck, trashes one of them costing from 3 to 6 coins, and discards the rest. If a Knight is trashed by this, trash this card. When you trash this, gain a Gold.
Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. The player to your left chooses one of them. Discard that card. Put the other cards into your hand.
Take a Coin token. SETUP: Each player takes a Coin token.

Take 2 Coin tokens. You may trash a card from your hand and then pay any number of Coin tokens. If you did trash a card, gain a card with a cost of up to the cost of the trashed card plus the number of Coin tokens you paid.

Name a card. Reveal the top 3 cards of your deck. Trash the matches. Put the rest back on top in any order. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each 1 coin you overpaid, look at the top card of your deck; trash it, discard it, or put it back.

Reveal the top card of your deck. If it is an Action, play it. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. For each 1 coin you overpaid, look through your discard pile and put a card from it on top of your deck.
Name a card. Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal 3 cards that are not the named card. Put those cards into your hand and discard the rest.
When you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain a Silver per 1 coin you overpaid.
While this is in play, when you buy a card, take a Coin token.
You may discard a Treasure card. If you do, take a Coin token.
Gain a Gold. Each other player gains a Curse. Each player who did draws a card.
Trash a card from your hand, Gain 2 cards each costing less than it. When you buy this, you may overpay for it. If you do, gain 2 Action cards each costing the amount you overpaid.

You may trash a Treasure from your hand. Each other player with 5 or more cards in hand discards a copy of it (or reveals a hand without it). Gain a Treasure card costing up to 3 Coins more than the trashed card, putting it on top of your deck.
Now and at the start of your next turn, choose one: +1 Coin; or trash a card from your hand; or gain a Silver.
Discard any number of cards. You may gain a card costing exactly 1 Coin per card discarded, putting it on top of your deck.
Each other player takes his -1 coin token. - While this is in play, cards cost 1 Coin less on your turns, but not less than 0 Coins.
When another player plays an Attack card, you may play this from your hand. (+1 Action has no effect if it\'s not your turn.)
For the rest of the game, when another player plays an Attack, it doesn\'t affect you, and when you play an Action, +1 Action. (This stays in play. This is not in the Supply.)
When you play this, put it on your Tavern mat. - Directly after resolving an Action, you may call this, for +2 Actions.
You may play an Action card from your hand twice. Gain a copy of it. - When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Teacher. (This is not in the Supply.)
Put this on your Tavern mat. - Worth 4 VP if on your Tavern mat at the end of the game (otherwise worth 0 VP).
Discard 2 cards. At the start of your next turn: +2 Cards, then discard 2 cards.
Put this on your Tavern mat. - When you gain a card costing up to 6 Coins, you may call this, to gain a copy of that card.
Discard a card. - When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Disciple. (This is not in the Supply.)
Set aside up to 2 cards from your hand face down. At the start of your next turn, put them into your hand.

Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). If it\'s face down, +1 Coin. If it\'s face up, +5 Coins, and each other player reveals the top card of his deck, trashes it if it costs from 3 to 6 Coins, and otherwise discards it and gains a Curse.
Put this on your Tavern mat. - At the start of your turn, you may call this, to discard your hand and draw 5 cards.
Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, he puts his hand on top of his deck in any order.
Gain a Treasure - When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Champion. (This is not in the Supply.)
At the start of each of your turns for the rest of the game: +1 Card. (This stays in play.)
When you gain this, each other player draws a card.
Reveal the top card of your deck. If it\'s a Treasure, put it into your hand. If it\'s an Action or Victory card, gain a Magpie.
You may put your deck into your discard pile. - When this is your first buy in a turn, gain a card costing up to 4 Coins, and each other player gains a copy of it.
Choose one: Put a Copper from your hand onto your Tavern mat; or +1 Coin per Copper on your Tavern mat.
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Treasure Hunter.
When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Soldier.
When you buy this, gain another Port.
Turn your Journey token over (it starts face up). If it\'s face up, +5 Cards.
Put this on your Tavern mat. - At the start of your turn, you may call this, to trash a card from your hand.
Trash this or a card from your hand. Look at a number of cards from the top of your deck equal to the cost in coins of the trashed card. Put one into your hand and discard the rest.
When you play this, each other player puts his -1 Card token on his deck.
Put this on your Tavern mat. - Directly after resolving an Action, if it\'s still in play, you may call this, to replay that Action.

+1 Coin per other Attack you have in play. Each other player with 4 or more cards in hand discards a card. - When you discard this from play, you may exchange it for a Fugitive. (This is not in the Supply.)
Play up to 3 Treasures from your hand. Pay all of your Coins; +1 Card per Coin paid.
Until your next turn, when any other player buys a card, he gains a Curse.

Put this on your Tavern mat. - At the start of your turn, you may call this, to move your +1 Card, +1 Action, +1 Buy, or +1 Coin token to an Action Supply pile you have no tokens on (when you play a card from that pile, you first get that bonus). (This is not in the Supply.)

Welcome to Androminion, an Android implementation of the award winning strategy card game Dominion, by Donald X. Vaccarino and published by Rio Grande Games.
If you are unfamiliar with how to play Dominion, it is highly recommended to read the official rules or the Wikipedia entry first. Links can be found at \n\t http://android.mehtank.com.

This is the card supply. Here you can see all of the cards available for purchase in this game. \n\nTo find out more information about a card, simply long-press on the card to bring up a dialog with its details.

Each card lists its cost in the yellow circle on the left of the card and the remaining quantity under the card name. \n\nIf Embargo is in play, the number of embargo tokens on a supply pile will be displayed in a black circle on the right of the card.
This is the turn view. Here you can see the stats about each player along with information about the current turn.
The current turn\'s player is highlighted, and the players are listed in turn order.
The numbers under the players\' names indicate the number of cards in their draw pile, hand, and deck (including any mats), respectively.
If Pirate Ships are in play, the number of pirate ship tokens is displayed in a red circle to the right of the player\'s name.
The current number of actions, buys, and money is listed at the bottom, along with a message about what input is being requested.
The first column shows the cards that are currently in your hand. This is only visible to you.
The second column shows the cards that have been played in the current turn. This is visible to everyone.
If you have cards in your Native Village or Island, swipe the view to the left to view the contents of those mats.
If any of these columns gets too big, you may need to drag the view up or down to see all the cards.
Again, you can long-press any card to bring up further details.
Finally, a history of the game is displayed in the scrollable game log at the bottom of your screen. \n\nYou can always bring up this help again through the menu while a game is running.

Good luck, and enjoy the game! 


			-:ankur

On network permissions and usage

This app functions by using a strictly local networking layer to talk between the player and the game -- currently, unless using multiplayer, no data is sent in or out of the phone. Nonetheless, this local network still requires networking permission, and such internal data transfer may show up as total app usage.

Steps to run a multiplayer game

You need the source code to compile the server vdom! In the vdom\\ directory, type \'ant run\' (or just start com.vdom.core.Game with whatever arguments you want - the build file build.xml has some default arguments). Be sure you know the host name or ip address for the machine that\'s running the game server, and that the player ports (by default 2255 and 2256) aren\'t blocked by your machine\'s firewall.
Open the app on two separate devices. Use the \"join game\" dialog to enter your name, the host name or ip address of the machine running the server, then the port that shows up in the terminal where you\'re running the server. Once the first player connects, a second port will show up; enter that one in on the second device (should be 2255 and 2256). The interface for the first player that connects will be missing a lot of stuff until the second player connects, but once both players are there, things work fine.

Source: https://code.google.com/p/androminion/issues/detail?id=582

Version 2.0

It has been a long while in coming, but we hope this update will have been worth the wait! There are so many changes that we can\'t list them all here, but below are some highlights:

* More expansions! Most of the cards from Alchemy, Prosperity, Cornucopia, and Hinterlands are now available.
* More game options! Chose from various random or preset decks, with 2-4 players.
* More AI options! Introducing new AIs Chuck, Mary, and Sarah.
* More bugfixes! Also more bugs, probably.
* Same great taste!

Androminion is now open source! This update would not have been possible without the help of a number of contributors; please view the credits tab. You too can help! Submit bug reports, feature requests, translations, and more on
http://androminion.googlecode.com
